弊習: (へいしゅう) - corrupt practices; bad habit
弊行: (へいこう) - this bank (humble); my bank
弊衣破帽: (へいいはぼう) - (yoji) shabby clothes and an old hat
弊衣蓬髪: (へいいほうはつ) - (yoji) unkempt hair and shabby clothes
弊風: (へいふう) - evil or corrupt or abusive practice
式: (shiki) - estilo, equação, fórmula, expressão; cerimônia; estilo
式を挙げる: (しきをあげる) - to hold a ceremony
式を立てる: (しきをたてる) - to formularize (a theory); to formularise
式内社: (しきないしゃ) - shrine listed in the Engi-Shiki
式叉摩那: (しきしゃまな) - probationary nun (undergoing a two-year probationary period before receiving ordainment) (san: siksamana)
式台: (しきだい) - step in a Japanese entranceway
式場: (しきじょう) - ceremonial hall (e.g. wedding, funeral); hall for ceremonies; place of ceremony
式年: (しきねん) - year in which an imperial memorial ceremony is held (the 3rd, 5th, 10th 20th, 50th & 100th years after death and every 100 years thereafter)
式年祭: (しきねんさい) - imperial memorial ceremony (held on the anniversary of the emperor's or empress's death, on fixed years)
式年遷宮: (しきねんせんぐう) - construction of a new shrine and transfer of the enshrined object from the old to the new, occurring at a regular, preordained time
式年遷宮祭: (しきねんせんぐうさい) - fixed-interval transfer ceremony (wherein a shrine's sacred object is transferred to a newly constructed main hall)
式日: (しきじつ) - day of a ceremony or event
式次: (しきじ) - program of a ceremony; programme of a ceremony
式次第: (しきしだい) - program of a ceremony (programme)
式神: (しきがみ) - form of magic or divination (e.g. animating objects to act as the sorcerer's agent)
式部: (しきぶ) - (Meiji era) official responsible for court ceremonies
式部官: (しきぶかん) - official responsible for court ceremonies
式部省: (しきぶしょう) - (Nara and Heian era) ministry of ceremonies
式部職: (しきぶしょく) - Board of Ceremonies (part of the Imperial Household Agency)
弐つ: (ふたつ) - two (used in old or legal documents)
弑逆: (しいぎゃく) - murder of one's own lord or father
弓: (kyuu/yumi) - bow , bow (weapon); archery; bow (for a violin, etc.)
弓は袋に太刀は鞘: (ゆみはふくろにたちはさや) - (proverb) the world is at peace; bows in bags and swords in sheaths
弓を引く: (ゆみをひく) - to draw a bow; to oppose; to defy; to disobey one's superiors
弓作成: (ゆみさくせい) - bowyery; bow making; bowcraft
弓偏: (ゆみへん) - kanji "bow" radical at left
弓具: (きゅうぐ) - things used in archery
弓勢: (ゆんぜい) - strength needed to pull back a bow
弓取り式: (ゆみとりしき) - bow-twirling ceremony at the end of a day of sumo wrestling
弓取式: (ゆみとりしき) - bow-twirling ceremony at the end of a day of sumo wrestling
弓場始め: (ゆばはじめ) - ceremony on the fifth day of the 10th lunar month in which the emperor would watch prize archery (Heian and Kamakura periods); first firing of the bow (after the New Year or the reconstruction of the archery range (in military families))
弓引く: (ゆみひく) - to bend a bow/to shoot an arrow; to rise up against/to rebel against
弓張: (ゆみはり) - stringing a bow/person who strings bows; crescent moon; paper lantern with a bow-shaped handle
弓張り: (ゆみはり) - stringing a bow/person who strings bows; crescent moon; paper lantern with a bow-shaped handle
弓張り提灯: (ゆみはりぢょうちん) - paper lantern with bow-shaped handle
弓張提灯: (ゆみはりぢょうちん) - paper lantern with bow-shaped handle
弓形: (きゅうけい) - arched; crescent-shaped; bow-shaped; segment
弓形になる: (ゆみなりになる) - to bend backward; to become bow-shaped
弓懸: (ゆがけ) - archer's glove (with a groove for pulling the string)
弓懸け: (ゆがけ) - archer's glove (with a groove for pulling the string)
弓手: (ゆんで) - one's left hand; bow hand
弓掛け: (ゆがけ) - archer's glove (with a groove for pulling the string)
弓矢八幡: (ゆみやはちまん) - (yoji) god of war
弓矢神道: (ゆみやしんとう) - Yumiya Shinto (Edo-period sect of Yoshida Shinto)
弓箭: (きゅうせん) - bows and arrows; war
弓馬刀槍: (きゅうばとうそう) - (yoji) archery, horsemanship, spearsmanship, and swordsmanship; martial arts in general
弓馬槍剣: (きゅうばそうけん) - (yoji) archery, horsemanship, spearsmanship, and swordsmanship; martial arts in general
弔い上げ: (とぶらいあげ) - last death anniversary for which there is a memorial service held (usu. the 32nd or 49th)
弔い合戦: (とむらいがっせん) - battle of revenge
弔う: (とぶらう) - to mourn for/to condole with (family, etc.); to hold a memorial service (for)
弔する: (ちょうする) - to mourn; to condole
弔問客: (ちょうもんきゃく) - condolence caller
弔客: (ちょうきゃく) - people attending a funeral or offering condolences
弔祭料: (ちょうさいりょう) - gift at a memorial service
